recipe_name: Couscous-coated goujons of salmon with warm tomato and herb salsa
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: For the salmon goujons, place the vegetable oil into a deep, heavy-based saucepan and heat until a small cube of bread sizzles and turns golden when dropped into it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Slice the salmon into four long strips. Dip the salmon strips in the beaten egg. Sprinkle the couscous onto a plate and coat the salmon slices in the couscous. Carefully place the salmon into the hot oil and deep fry for about 3-4 minutes, or until crisp and cooked through. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. For the tomato salsa, heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the garlic, tomatoes and chilli flakes and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Stir in the balsamic vinegar. Serve the salmon goujons on a plate with the salsa and garnish with parsley.
ingredients: vegetable oil, for deep frying,  100g/3½oz salmon fillet, skin removed,  1 free-range egg, beaten,  55g/2oz couscous,  1 tbsp olive oil,  1 garlic clove, finely chopped,  2 tomatoes, chopped,  ¼ tsp dried chilli flakes,  1 tbsp balsamic vinegar,  chopped fresh parsley, to garnish
